sen.j: 平家公達草紙によると、安元2年（1176年）3月の後白河法皇50歳の祝賀の催し「安元の賀」に兄達四人と共に彼の名前が見られる。

sen.j: 『平家物語』の「六代被斬」によると、忠房は平氏が屋島の戦いで敗れた後、ひそかに陣を抜け出し、紀伊国の豪族湯浅宗重の庇護を受けて同地に潜伏する。
sen.e: According to the part of Rokudai kirare in "Heike Monogatari (The tale of the Heike)," Tadafusa escaped in secrecy from the armed camp of Taira clan when they were defeated at the Battle of Yashima, and concealed himself under the protection of a powerful regional clan of Muneshige YUASA in Kii Province.
sen.cmt: 「六代被斬」が分かりません。左記のようにしています。
sen.e: According to the part of the Rokudai kirare in "Heike Monogatari (The tale of the Heike)," Tadafusa escaped in secrecy from the armed camp of the Taira clan when they were defeated at the Battle of Yashima, and he concealed himself under the protection of a powerful regional clan of Muneshige YUASA in Kii Province.

According to 'Rokudai Kirare' in "Heike Monogatari" (The tale of the Heike), Tadafusa escaped in secrecy from the camp of the Taira clan after being defeated at the Battle of Yashima, and he hid under the protection of the powerful Muneshige YUASA in Kii Province.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 壇ノ浦の戦いで平家一門が滅亡した後、源頼朝による追討を受けるも、宗重や平景清ら平家の残党が忠房の元に集い、3ヶ月の篭城という徹底抗戦する。
sen.e: After the Heike clan ruined at the Battle of Dannoura, though Tadafusa was chased by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, the remnants of the Heike clan such as Muneshige and TAIRA no Kagekiyo got together at Tadafusa and they made a do-or-die resistance, holding castle for 3 months.

After the Heike clan was destroyed at the Battle of Dannoura, though Tadafusa was pursued by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, the remnants of the Heike clan such as Muneshige and TAIRA no Kagekiyo got together at Tadafusa and they made a do-or-die resistance, holding the castle for 3 months.

After the downfall of the Taira clan at the Battle of Dannoura, Tadafusa was pursued by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo but the remnants of the Taira clan including Muneshige and TAIRA no Kagekiyo banded around Tadafusa and mounted a do-or-die resistance in which it is said that they hold the castle for three months.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: しかし「重盛には旧恩があり、その息子は助命する」という頼朝の偽りの誘いを受けて降人となり、鎌倉に出頭する。
sen.e: However, Tadafusa took Yoritomo's words seriously that Yoritomo had an old favor from Shigemori and Yoritomo would help his son Tadafusa, thus Tadafusa surrendered to Yoritomo and appeared at Kamakura.

However, Tadafusa believed Yoritomo's lie that 'he owed Shigemori an old favor and would spare his son's life,' so surrendered and turned himself in at Kamakura.

sen.j: 頼朝に面会した後、京に送還されるが、その途上頼朝の命を受けた後藤基清によって斬られた。
sen.e: After Tadafusa met Yoritomo, he was sent back to Kyo (the capital), however, he was killed on the way by Motokiyo GOTO who was ordered by Yoritomo.

sen.j: 『吉記』には文治元年（1185年）12月8日の項に、「同日、小松内府息忠房招引関東事」とあり、16日に「忠房被切首事」との記述がある。
sen.e: In the entry of December 8, 1185 (lunar calendar date) of Kikki (a diary of Tunefusa YOSHIDA), "On the day Tadafusa, the son of Komatsu-naifu (the title of his father) was brought to Kanto" and on the 16th, "Tadafusa was cut by his neck."
sen.cmt: 「小松内府息忠房」は、「小松内府の子息、忠房」と読みましたが不明です。左記の様にしています。
sen.e: In the entry of December 8, 1185 (lunar calendar date) of Kikki (a diary of Tunefusa YOSHIDA), "On the day Tadafusa, the son of Komatsu-naifu (the title of his father) was brought to Kanto" and on the 16th, "Tadafusa's neck was cut."

The January 7, 1186 entry in Kikki (a diary of Tsunefusa YOSHIDA) reads 'On this day, Tadafusa, the son of Komatsu-naifu (the title of his father) was summoned to the Kanto region' and on the entry for the 16th state that 'Tadafusa was beheaded.'
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。グレゴリオ暦に直し、スペル修正、クォーテーションの位置を修正しました。

tit.e: Namida ga iso (rocky shore of tears)
Namida ga iso (rocky shore of tears)

sen.j: 丹後の伝承によると、忠房には白拍子花松との間との間に遺児がおり、平家滅亡を聞いた彼女は丹後に潜んでいたが源氏の捜索が及ぶのを恐れ、子供を道連れとみせかけて自ら岩から身投げをしたという話も残っている。
sen.e: According to tradition of Tango Province, there was a child of between Tadafusa and Hanamatsu, a dancing girl, and though Hanamatsu concealed herself in Tango when she heard the ruin of the Heike clan, a day she jumped to her death from the rock as if she were with her child fearing the hunting down by Genji clan.

According to a tradition in Tango Province, there was a child between Tadafusa and Hanamatsu, a dancing girl, and though Hanamatsu concealed herself in Tango, when she heard about the Heike clan being destoyed, she purposely jumped to her death making it appear that she took her child with her being afraid that the Genji clan would hunt down her child if they thought the child was still alive..

According to Tango Province legend, stories remain that Tadafusa had a child with a prostitute named Hanamatsu who hid in Tango upon hearing about the downfall of the Taira family, but she feared that she would be discovered by the Minamoto clan so threw herself from a rock, making it appear as if she had taken her child with her with her.
